episode_summary: This episode covers a range of fascinating topics including the dangers of bathing in the Roman baths due to brain-eating amoebas, the unique job of ham sniffers in Spain, the rediscovery of a Donatello sculpture being used as an ashtray, and the existence of bendy rocks.

facts.fact: The reason you can no longer bathe in the Roman baths at Bath is because they contain brain-eating amoeba.
There is a Spanish firm which has six official ham sniffers; their job is to poke pork loins, sniff them, and make sure they're good.
Until it was identified by an art dealer in 1975, Donatello's bronze, the Madonna and Child, was being used as an ashtray and a tiddlywink bowl.
There is such a thing as bendy rocks.
